Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a bit far out of the way”
Reviews.Author: rslev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April. It's a very nice hotel (beautiful decor - in the room and out) and the staff is quite helpful. We also liked some of the little touches, like the old bookstore (more of a library) on the 2nd floor and the gift shop of the Istanbul Modern (also on the 2nd floor). Also the wifi is free and very fast. We didn't eat dinner or lunch there but there are some nice restaurants across the street. But we did eat breakfast in the hotel, which is quite a spread. Also our views were just so-so (room 711 and then 603), but there might be others with better ones. I guess my only complaint is that the hotel is quite far north so if you are planning to spend a lot of time in Old Town this may not be the best choice, especially given how bad traffic is in Istanbul (when it rains it comes to a standstill). It's also fairly far from the airport. When there was no traffic (like 5am in the morning) getting to the airport was a breeze, but in the mid-morning rush hour it was quite long. Just something to keep in mind. Otherwise, I would highly recommend the hotel. Oh, one other note - we forgot to ask for a non-smoking room and the first room we stayed in (711) cigarette smoke was definitely noticeable (we didn't try airing out the room by opening the windows, but it probably wouldn't have made a difference as I'm sure occupants near by where smoking in their rooms). We then went to Cappadocia for a few days and when we came back to the hotel they put us in a non-smoking room (on the 6th floor) but it didn't seem to make a difference - the room smelled exactly like the one on the 7th floor. So if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke then perhaps this hotel isn't for you either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cypriotalien
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel and attended a conference there. The rooms are very nicely decorated and are very pleasant. Stayed on the 13th floor and had a view of the bosporus bridge. The restaurant that we used for breakfast and lunch on the 18th Floor had excellent food and great views. The seaguls tend to sit on the ledge and beg for food and people invariably open the window and indulge them, quite amazing to see them fly around the building. The conference facilities on the B2 level we used were excellent. All in all there was a great ambiance throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, professional and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MunichStar73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a business trip. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Whilst there, I received a delivery which they brought to my room in my absence. The rooms a spacious and cosy and service included free Wifi. Everything was new and clean and even the gym has the latest equipment and is also well kept. The restaurant on the top floor has a stunning view of the Bosphorous and the buffets at breakfast and lunch had plenty of variety and tasted good. As I ate out in the evening, I cannot comment on dinner. For a business traveller this is a perfect hotel and has a business centre as well as conference facilities. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: inci61
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel; two were for business. Although the hotel is far from the airport, it is almost at the center of the city where you can reach most of the places by taxi easily. If you are lucky to get a room with the Bosphorous view, you can enjoy the magnificent Istanbul during day and night. The breakfast area is at the top 18th floor with the same extraordinary view of the Bosphorous.The breakfast is open buffet with a wide variety of food. The rooms are clean, functional, big enough to enjoy the room, modern art all over the walls, very comfortable and most importantly the bed and the pillows are special for a good sleep; you can even make a choice from a pillow menu. The meeting rooms are also great for small meetings. The elevators are fun with the digital girl constantly doing funny face mimics- you donâ€™t feel how the seconds past so easily even if you are going up to the top floor. Staff is very kind and friendly. And the best part; you have free Wi-Fi even in the room. Overall it is a very nice and comfortable hotel with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: fahademad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel very recently for business, hotel is very clean, the room is well maintained. Free wifi was excellent, swimming pool and the gym area also very good. The hotel located in good area, you can walk to exchange office-Starbucks-supermarket, and most famous shopping malls are nearby ( walking-Taxi or metro). All in all I can not think of one bad thing, and would go there again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the point Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerard O
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly impressed by my recent stay at the point Hotel. The staff were not only incredibly professional but also very friendly and helpful. The quality of the room was better than I had hoped for. There was a lovely office area and sitting area with free very high speed Internet access. The bed was not only huge but very comfortable. Downstairs there is the biggest games room I have ever seen in my life in any Hotel !!! My teenage sons would have loved it ï�Š Also a very well equipped gymnasium and pool. Free to guests. there is a nice coffee shop in the lobby with a choice of different restaurants. Breakfast is served in the beautiful penthouse restaurant on the 18th floor which has a magnificent view over the Bosporus and the first bridge. It is within good walking distance of many of the shops, and there is a Starbucks about 50 meters away !! What more could you ask ï�Š Gerard

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: inotx6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Point Hotel Barbaros in December 2011. The room was spacious and clean. The restaurant on the 18-th floor has fantastic view of the Istanbul, especially at the night. The service was excellent. I certainly will go again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I like Urban style”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner82
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room # 808 , the Bosphorus view is nice ...if you like urban style like me you will like it , location is very good for Business travelers the staff were extra helpful , service is fast and good ,thatâ€™s what I liked about it , minor negative (points) like carpet vacuuming wasnâ€™t that good and the decoration of the rooms was not as good as the lobby and the internal spaces , however it was pleasant 2 nights stay .

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Stefano964
Reviews.Content: I chose the Point Hotel Barbaros on the suggestion of a local partner and I must say I was very happy with the choice. The hotel is located close to Besiktas area, in a zone with intense real estate development. The view from the room was very good, overlooking the Bosphorus and one of the main bridges between Asia and Europe. Room was clean and adequate size, wi-fi was free in the whole hotel and service was very attentive. The only problem I saw was the heavy traffic in the area, but that is true also in many other area of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great service, top quality!”
Reviews.Author: Altug G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business for a week. Let me warn you first: If you aim to see the historic side of Istanbul, you're in the wrong part of the city. try to find a hotel in Sultanahmet district instead, which are typically within walking distance of historic sites. The hotel is ideally located for business traveler (very near and sometimes within walking distance of most large corporations or a short taxi ride away) within a nice neighborhood. you can easily take a walk on the street late at night comfortably and there are nice restaurants that serve seafood, kebab, Ottoman cuisine (no alcohol here), etc. Be advised, though, this part of the city is ALWAYS windy so it is wise to have your windbreaker with you all the time. Hotel is very modern, having built less than 5 years ago. Decoration is very modern and as the receptionist can tell you, it is the first "Art-Tech" hotel in Turkey. Reception area is spacious, with attentive staff that focuses on customer satisfaction. In about 5 to 10 minutes you can be in your room, unpacking. I stayed as part of a business package and had a French Executive suite. I don't know about the regular rooms but this suite is large, well decorated and designed with the business traveler's needs in mind. My package included free high-speed Internet access throughout the hotel, free access to executive lounge, business center, gym facilities, pool and Gamer club. Unfortunately, I didn't have time to enjoy these facilities so I can't comment on them but Internet is REALLY high speed and I didn't experience any disconnection or slowdown. Elevators are fast and efficient (read: first cabin with available space will stop at your floor) with a modern decor. Hint: there is no sensor in the elevators so the video being played is just a plain video; but watching it is really entertaining :) This suite has a large bathroom (again, beautifully decorated) with vanity supplements, very large shower stall with ceiling-mounted showerhead (a welcome difference than most hotels) in addition to handheld variety with steady water pressure and temperature. A full-size glass working desk with compartments to stuff your things was a nice complement in the room's decoration. If you're using laser or optical mice with your notebook, glass surface can be a hindrance, though. If you don't have a mouse pad or mouse mat, use any of the various magazines available on the table. Right beside the table is a patch panel, through which you can connect your notebook if you have required cables. Thus, if you want to watch a movie on the 42" Sony Bravia TV in the room rather than on the (comparably) small LCD on your notebook, just connect your notebook to the patch panel via a suitable HDMI cable (you have one with you, right?), set the TV input, then lay down on the comfy bed and enjoy yourself! Or simply turn on your favorite music and enjoy it while shaving, since a speaker is also mounted in the bathroom ceiling. Nice touch! Speaking of movies and music, don't worry about disturbing the neighbors. The hotel has excellent sound insulation and I was never disturbed by the sound of elevators (my room was next to them!), other guests speaking in the corridor or whatever they were doing in their rooms. Same goes for outside noise. Even though you're right in the middle of one of the busiest parts of the city, traffic noise or city sounds simply don't exist in the room. This guarantees a sound sleep! The hotel sports a pillow menu. If you're like me and prefer a semi-stiff silicon pillow, you only need to tick your choice and leave the form with the reception. Housekeeping will bring you your pillow. Complimentary kettle with instant coffee and tea was available in the room. I don't know why many other hotels in Turkey do not provide this nicety (as many hotels in Europe and US do) but this hotel does. Minibar was well stocked with quality stuff and the prices were not very steep compared to other 5-star hotels. Another nice detail was the condom available in the mini bar, if you find yourself somehow unprepared. Hint: Warm it in your hand before using it ;) Air conditioning was another joy! Not only was that whisper-quiet, but also did a very good job of keeping the room at my favorite temperature. When I wanted to raise it, it complied and heated the room within a quarter hour. Being used to the air conditioning units that have engine-truck noise levels, this was a great surprise for me. It also handles cigar smoke very well, too! Unfortunately, no cigar ashtrays were available in the room, but that's just me being excessively picky. Another nice detail was the couch/luggage rest kind of thing. It is large enough to place your luggage on (it can easily seat two of them) and you still have enough clearance to walk freely. Or, if you choose, you can place your stuff in the closet, stow your luggage away and use it as a couch. However, the very comfortable leather seat together with its footrest and the end table (with wheels for a change!) right beside would probably make you want to use it instead. Lighting in the room was well designed. You can control lights from the panels available at the door, beside the table or beside the bed. Some lights have multiple settings and dimmer controls so experiment with them until you find the best combination. A Sony alarm clock/radio with CD-player unit was also available in the room. Nicest surprise was the presence of "Lullabies" music CD if you prefer to sleep to some great tune. Kudos! Now, the most important part: The Bed. This hotel is featuring Yatas SweetDreams line of sleepwear, which is very comfortable. Not very soft, not very stiff, it provides great sleeping experience. If you are one of those people that tend to have difficulty sleeping in a bed not your own, a book with tips to help you go to sleep easily is also present right beside your bed. Sheets were crisp and very clean. I don't know about the duvet, as I tend not to use it, thanks to the excellent air conditioning in the room. Room service was very efficient, kind and timely. Although their service personnel can use a little bit more of orientation, quality of food more than made up for it. Tip: If you order a beer and no bottle-opener was provided with it, prongs of your fork can be used :) Breakfast buffet was extensive, with many choices of cheese, cold cuts, hot food, fruits and corn flakes and mÃ¼sli. However, I have seen more fruit juice types available in other hotels (only orange juice was available) and I'd like to see more doughware (Danish pastries and croissants would be great). View of the Bosphorus from the breakfast lounge is also breathtaking. Taxis are available right at the entrance of the hotel. Just ask the staff and a clean, yellow cab with a working meter will be there within seconds. You can also ask the driver for a receipt at the end of the trip :) Finally: Price! The price may sound a bit steep if you book through the hotel's own site. However, if you're traveling on business like me, ask your travel department for a corporate rate and get a French Executive suite like I did. It was really worth every single penny! I remember paying much more for the other well known hotel chains, both in Turkey, Europe, US, Middle East and Africa, for much less quality and worse experience. My only concern now is, having seen all the quality, luxury and great service in The Point Hotel Barbaros, I probably will be disappointed with most of the other hotels within tha same price range. Also, if more people who read this review tend to choose this hotel, room availability will drop :) However, I'm a frequent business traveler like many people who use TripAdvisor, and I believe we should help each other.

Reviews.Title: “a must for gamers and not only....”
Reviews.Author: andynab
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business trip in June 11 and as usually happen you have to find something before going out for dinner so I decided to accept a free hour for the game Zone floor. It is amazing , in the dark with many games spot , you can use PS/3 + car seat, adventure games and many others.( very nice also with friend or colleagues) you can lose your time down there ! There is also an hotel built around this floor of course !! very nice with a wonderful view of Istanbul during breakfast. Hotel personnel (mainly waiters during breaskfast/dinner) as always here, too many and not inclined to be take care the guest as should be . Nice room with huge shower and Wi fi free ..a must be !

Reviews.Title: “HAVE A GREAT SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: tiye34
Reviews.Content: I had a business stay at this hotel but even if I go for holiday I will be willingly to stay. Hotel has a very good location you can go the metro station and Astoria Shopping Mall by walking. It is also easy to many places by taxi. I love the view of the Istanbul Bosphorous , I fell in love again this beautiful city. Hotel has breakfast area ay the 17 th floor with amazing view. As a great beginning of the day you must have your nice breakfast which is better than any similar hotels . Delicious , fresh, clean. I like the sweets especially chocolate cheese cake ï�Š Rooms are comfortable and especially created for a good sleep. You should try. There is no noise coming from outside, soft colors relax you. But most important , bed , pillows, blankets are specially made for Point Hotel Sleeping Quality. After busy day nice shower , lying down on this bed makes you feel really comfortable. Before you sleep , you can read the book that advice you 101 points to have a good sleep and there are complimentary almond and nuts which help you for a good sleep. As last step there is CD prepared for the Point Hotel Barbaros â€˜ s guests. Listen this .. I travel a lot , there is only one hotel that it is best prepared for relax and sleep At least one night , stay there are sleep. Have nice rest ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Well above average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: seanyg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located within the CBD, and fairly close (when traffic permits) to many of the sights and experiences that Istanbul has to offer. Rooms are clean, modern and comfortable and the gym facilities are also very good. Breakfast on the 18th floor offers an excellent choice, and the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good decor and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: gdbhinge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located little away from airport but it is close to central business & tourist interest area. The decor is modern, new and very attractive. The executive rooms have separate breakfast area with nice view from top. Also you can have snacks and drinks in the evening while checking your mails or having a business meeting. Breakfast has good choice and nice preparations. Good hospitality and prompt service. English knowledge of staff is good comapred to my earlier experience in Turkey. Overall very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect either for business or for leisure”
Reviews.Author: LarisaVM
Reviews.Content: Very nice, high quality hotel. Comfortable stylish rooms, perfect bed, great sleep. Excellent meal. The only thing frustrated me was the room light. I always kept seeking the approrpiate button, yet not all of them were working. The location is not good if you aim at sightseeing - you would need transportation. The shopping center - Astoria - is within walking distance. So, good luck for your stay in Point Barbaros!

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: kerem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Executive room. The room was very basic and its decoration was boring. The floor carpet and the walls are both grey color also poor lightenning makes it depressive.. The breakfast was disappointing, tasteless, cheap foods and the service is not satisfying. There were some small flies on some food on open breakfast buffet and it seems that it is not hygenic. The elevators of the hotel are not sufficent, too much waiting time for the elevators.. The hotel is far from major touristic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - modern, clean, stylish, great rooms & decor”
Reviews.Author: fivesheds
Reviews.Content: Stayed several nights recently & this is a very good hotel. Plenty of positives ! Very modern, well equipped rooms, Some minor niggles only

Reviews.Title: “Silent Wakeup In the morning!”
Reviews.Author: firemode
Reviews.Content: After working and walking down to the center of the nicely crowded Istanbul its always good to come back to a hotel where staff will welcome you and take good care. Its very convenient in terms of raching cabs and public transportation, but a little walking for like up 10-12 minutes is needed to Metro ..

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, great art, location OK”
Reviews.Author: MarvelleMaher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in February as part of a work conference. The hotel is stunning, with all new modern features, modern art all over the hotel, lightning fast lifts, and very nice bars. The rooms were spacious with VERY comfortable beds - you even get a pillow menu to choose which kinds of pillows. The whole place has a decidedly "W" vibe to the place. There is house music playing in the elevator (you cannot and will not miss the digital woman in the elevator with you constantly winking at you and fixing her hair... very odd and talk-provoking piece of art). The closest fun Turkish neighborhood around is Besiktas (Besh-ick-TASH) but you are no where near Bebek, Sultanahmet, Taksim Square or any other must-see place in Istanbul. But, you're a short taxi ride away (depending on traffic). Overall, Point Hotel is great for work, and great of you if you don't mind location and want to be pampered in a nice, modern hotel. The bar/drinks are expensive, but not more so than any other nice place in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, deserves a good look!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business in December 2009. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel. Everything was nice and I can't think of a major issue. Since this was my initial trip to Istanbul, I am not certain if the location was the best, but it worked for me. As usual, the Good, Bad, and Ugly. The Good - Room size and cleanliness. Nice room size to work from and it was spotless from top to bottom. Kudos to the cleaning staff. - Bed and pillow comfort. Excellent on both counts with a pillow menu in case I preferred one type over the other. - Check-in. As should always happen, a receptionist escorted me to my room to ensure everything was fine and walk through the details of my stay and the surroundings. Much appreciated. - Free WiFi service. As a back-up, they had an Ethernet cable in the room. Nice touch. - Breakfast. Wide variety, great view of city. Real nice. - Bathroom. Large shower (no tub) with all the amenities necessary. The Bad - WiFi. Look hotels, if I cannot get WiFi in my room, then advertise it as such "Free WiFi in the lobby, and hallways..." Be honest. Not only could I not get solid reception in my room, but WiFi did not exist in the breakfast room. Now, hats off again to the Point Hotel for providing it for free and having an Ethernet cable. That saved them in my eyes! - Nothing else. The Ugly - Nothing! Again, real solid hotel. Appears to be new with all of the amenities in very good shape. I would stay there again without hesitation.

HotelInfo.Name: Point Hotel Barbaros
HotelInfo.Address: Yildiz Posta Caddesi 29 | Esentepe Sisli, Istanbul 34394, Turkey
